c74object.name: cage.trim
c74object.description: Removes the starting or ending empty time in a bach.roll or bach.score.

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs result of the last trimming.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the inlet is considered as the score gathered syntax. The trimming operation is performed and the trimmed score in gathered syntax is output through the outlet. The output header content is the same as the input header content.

attribute.name: end
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to trim the empty time at the end of the score. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: markermode
attribute.description:
Sets the way markers should be handled.
When it is set to 0, markers are considered as important as notes in order to determined the portions of scores to be trimmed, and are kept while trimming (default).
When it is set to 1, markers are ignored while determining the trimming portion, and markers falling inside the trimming portion are shifted to the new score start or end point.
When it is set to 2, markers are ignored while determining the trimming portion, and markers falling inside the trimming portion are deleted.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to trim the empty time at the beginning of the score. Defaults to 1.
